strategy: Compute item averages ONLY for manufacturer 29 items within the filtered sales. Use a single CTE that: (1) filters catalog_sales by date, (2) joins with items filtered by manufacturer, (3) computes pe
what_worked: Applied single_pass_aggregation, early_filter, pushdown: Replaced correlated subquery with a single CTE that filters sales by date and manufacturer, computes per-item average via window function, then filters rows where discount exceeds threshold.
why_it_worked: Consolidating repeated scans into CASE aggregates reduces I/O from N scans to 1; Applying selective filters early reduces intermediate row counts before expensive operations; Pushing predicates closer to table scans reduces data volume in upper operators
